intro: Malachra horrida, commonly known as the horrid malachra, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, disturbed habitats.
